verses.text: Listen , O isles , unto me; and hearken , ye people , from far ; The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath called me from the womb ; from the bowels of my mother hath he made mention of my name.
And he hath made my mouth like a sharp sword ; in the shadow of his hand hath he hid me, and made me a polished shaft ; in his quiver hath he hid me;
And said unto me, Thou \add art\add* my servant , O Israel , in whom I will be glorified.

Then I said , I have laboured in vain , I have spent my strength for nought , and in vain : \add yet\add* surely my judgment \add is\add* with the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and my work with my God.\f + \fr 49.4 \ft my work: or, my reward\f* \p

¶ And now, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* that formed me from the womb \add to be\add* his servant , to bring Jacob again to him, Though Israel be not gathered , yet shall I be glorious in the eyes of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and my God shall be my strength.  +  r 49.5  t Though…: or, That Israel may be gathered to him, and I may, etc *

And he said , It is a light thing that thou shouldest be my servant to raise up the tribes of Jacob , and to restore the preserved of Israel : I will also give thee for a light to the Gentiles , that thou mayest be my salvation unto the end of the earth.\f + \fr 49.6 \ft It is…: or, Art thou lighter than that thou shouldest, etc\f*\f + \fr 49.6 \ft preserved: or, desolations\f* \p

Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, the Redeemer of Israel , \add and\add* his Holy One , to him whom man despiseth , to him whom the nation abhorreth , to a servant of rulers , Kings shall see and arise , princes also shall worship , because of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* that is faithful , \add and\add* the Holy One of Israel , and he shall choose thee.  +  r 49.7  t whom man…: or, that is despised in soul *

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, In an acceptable time have I heard thee, and in a day of salvation have I helped thee: and I will preserve thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people , to establish the earth , to cause to inherit the desolate heritages ;\f + \fr 49.8 \ft establish: or, raise up\f*
That thou mayest say to the prisoners , Go forth ; to them that \add are\add* in darkness , Shew yourselves. They shall feed in the ways , and their pastures \add shall be\add* in all high places.
They shall not hunger nor thirst ; neither shall the heat nor sun smite them: for he that hath mercy on them shall lead them, even by the springs of water shall he guide them.
And I will make all my mountains a way , and my highways shall be exalted.
Behold, these shall come from far : and, lo, these from the north and from the west ; and these from the land of Sinim. \p

¶ Sing , O heavens ; and be joyful , O earth ; and break forth into singing , O mountains : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath comforted his people , and will have mercy upon his afflicted.
But Zion said , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath forsaken me, and my Lord hath forgotten me.

Can a woman forget her sucking child , that she should not have compassion on the son of her womb ? yea, they may forget , yet will I not forget thee.\f + \fr 49.15 \ft that…: Heb. from having compassion\f*
Behold, I have graven thee upon the palms of \add my\add* hands ; thy walls \add are\add* continually before me.
Thy children shall make haste ; thy destroyers and they that made thee waste shall go forth of thee. \p

¶ Lift up thine eyes round about , and behold : all these gather themselves together , \add and\add* come to thee. \add As\add* I live , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, thou shalt surely clothe thee with them all, as with an ornament , and bind them \add on thee\add*, as a bride \add doeth\add*.
For thy waste and thy desolate places , and the land of thy destruction , shall even now be too narrow by reason of the inhabitants , and they that swallowed thee up shall be far away.
The children which thou shalt have, after thou hast lost the other, shall say again in thine ears , The place \add is\add* too strait for me: give place to me that I may dwell.

Then shalt thou say in thine heart , Who hath begotten me these, seeing I have lost my children , and am desolate , a captive , and removing to and fro ? and who hath brought up these? Behold, I was left alone; these, where \add had\add* they \add been\add*?

Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*, Behold, I will lift up mine hand to the Gentiles , and set up my standard to the people : and they shall bring thy sons in \add their\add* arms , and thy daughters shall be carried upon \add their\add* shoulders.\f + \fr 49.22 \ft arms: Heb. bosom\f*

And kings shall be thy nursing fathers , and their queens thy nursing mothers : they shall bow down to thee with \add their\add* face toward the earth , and lick up the dust of thy feet ; and thou shalt know that I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: for they shall not be ashamed that wait for me.\f + \fr 49.23 \ft nursing fathers: Heb. nourishers\f*\f + \fr 49.23 \ft queens: Heb. princesses\f* \p
¶ Shall the prey be taken from the mighty , or the lawful captive delivered ?\f + \fr 49.24 \ft lawful…: Heb. captivity of the just\f*

But thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away , and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered : for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and I will save thy children.\f + \fr 49.25 \ft captives: Heb. captivity\f*

And I will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh ; and they shall be drunken with their own blood , as with sweet wine : and all flesh shall know that I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add am\add* thy Saviour and thy Redeemer , the mighty One of Jacob.\f + \fr 49.26 \ft sweet: or, new\f*
